meanings.definition: A single-celled organism that lacks a distinct nucleus and other membrane-bound organelles.
meanings.sent1: Prokaryotes can be found in various environments.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study prokaryotes to understand their structure.
meanings.sent3: The prokaryotes in the pond were having a tiny dance party.
meanings.sent4: In the world of cells, prokaryotes are the minimalist architects.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, prokaryotes look like tiny blobs of life.

meanings.sent1: Many illnesses are caused by harmful prokaryotes.
meanings.sent2: The soil is teeming with prokaryotes that play a vital role in decomposition.
meanings.sent3: The prokaryotes in the petri dish were gossiping about the amoebas.
meanings.sent4: In the microbial world, prokaryotes are the unsung heroes.
meanings.sent5: The ocean is a vast playground for countless prokaryotes.
